Sometimes flutter clean can appear to ‚Äúhang‚Äù on macOS ‚Äî especially if there are a lot of generated files, or if Xcode‚Äôs DerivedData folders are huge.

‚úÖ Try These Steps

  1. Cancel the stuck command Hit CTRL + C.

  2. Clean manually (same effect as flutter clean)
    You can delete these build/cache folders yourself: 
    rm -rf build/ .dart_tool/ ios/Pods ios/Podfile.lock ios/Flutter/Flutter.framework ios/Flutter/Flutter.podspec

    If you also want Xcode‚Äôs cache gone:

    rm -rf ~/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData
  3. Re-get dependencies 
    flutter pub get
  4. Reinstall CocoaPods (for iOS) 
    cd ios
pod install --repo-update
cd ..
  5. Build/run again 
    flutter run

‚ö° Tip: The first time after cleaning may take a little longer (since Flutter needs to regenerate .dart_tool, .pub-cache, iOS Pods, etc.), but it should not stay frozen forever. If you keep seeing it ‚Äústuck‚Äù, it might be related to:

  • Outdated Flutter SDK ‚Üí Run flutter upgrade
  • Outdated CocoaPods ‚Üí Run sudo gem install cocoapods
  • Rosetta / M1 chip issues: If you‚Äôre on Apple Silicon, sometimes you need to run arch -x86_64 pod install inside the ios folder, depending on your setup.
